This section allows you to remove all posts and or topics started by a member
%s posts processed (%s posts and %s topics examined)...
Deleting posts and topics is fairly intensive.
Delete ALL of this member's %s TOPICS?
If enabled: all topics started by this member will be deleted, regardless of other member's replies.
If enabled: a topic started by this member that has no replies is deleted otherwise the topic is left.
Delete ALL of this member's %s POSTS?
Members posts and topics will be placed in the trashcan instead of deleted.

If you fill in more than one field, only the FIRST valid field will be saved. For example, if you enter a URL and choose an image from the avatar gallery, the URL will be used for the user's avatar. If the user currently has an uploaded avatar, it will be removed upon submission of this form.
Please enter the width and height for the uploaded or linked avatar

Note, if you enable this moderators will have warn permissions on any users, regardless of forum.
Can flag a member as a spammer?

Can set topics as visible and invisible?
If you require a password to access this forum, you can select groups who will not need to enter the password in.
Default date cut off for topic display
Leave this box empty if you do not wish to require this.
This can be left blank. You can enter multiple ones by seperating them with a comma.
Requires a moderator to manually add posts/topics to the forum.
Email addresses to send new topic awaiting approval notification
This is the minium number of posts a user must have before they can view the forum and any posts in it.
This is the minium number of posts a user must have before they can post in this forum.
If enabled, posts in this forum increase member's cumulative post count.
If enabled, a poll vote will move the topic to the top of the list when sorted by date.
This will allow HTML to be posted and executed for allowed groups.
Useful if you have settings that prohibit some members from seeing posts in this forum while allowing them to see the forum itself
If yes, the member will be able to see the topic titles but will not be able to read the topic posts when clicked.

You may use HTML - linebreaks automatically converted to <br>.
If left blank, a default 'permission denied' error is used.
If 'yes' you can skip the rest of this form as the settings will have no effect and this forum will act like as a redirect link. Current posts will not be accessible when enabled.
Allow members who can see the forum but cannot read topics to see the topic list
Treat this forum as a category? (No posts in it)

If this is set to 'Yes' previously posted topics will not display, and posting in this forum will not be allowed. Users will only be allowed to view the subforums under this forum. If this is set to yes, the rest of the settings will have no effect.
You may use HTML - linebreaks automatically converted to <br>

Move all subforums for this forum to which forum?

Checks for new articles every n minutes. Minimum of 30 minutes, regardless of input.
Imports n articles per update. Importing is moderately resource intensive.
If 'yes' the topic will be posted as invisible. 'No', topic will be visible
This prefix will be added to the beginning of the RSS item's title
If 'yes' the topic will be posted as open. 'No', topic will be closed
*Leave blank to not include a link in the post
This will increment this poster's post count in forums where post counts are enabled

BBCode allowed: {url} = URL to article
If completed, this will add a link to the article source (if available) to the post body
This will post the RSS topic under this person's account (member display name)
If yes, raw HTML is preserved along with any 'badwords' - you MUST have HTML enabled when editing imported posts or HTML will be removed upon edit. If no, HTML is converted to BBCode where possible.
Choose a forum to import each RSS item as a new topic
Most streams do not require authentication
Examples: ISO-8859-1, UTF-8. Use UTF-8 if in doubt.
This must be an RDF or RSS feed
Leave blank to remove them all
